description.value:
Totem of Boar

Totem Spirit (War) — Creation Cost: 8 Gnosis

Spirit Aspect: Relentless Assault / Momentum

Individual Trait

The creature who touches the Totem gains the following benefit until the next long rest:

  • When you take damage, you gain a +1 bonus to melee damage rolls until the end of your next turn (stacks once, max +3)
  • You have advantage on saving throws against being knocked prone

Only one creature may benefit from this trait at a time.

Pack Trait

As an action, a creature touching the Totem may invoke Boar's charge.

For 1 minute, while within 20 feet of the Totem:

  • The first time each pack member takes damage on their turn, they may immediately move up to 10 feet toward a hostile creature without provoking opportunity attacks
  • Once during the duration, one pack member may make a melee attack as a reaction after being hit

This movement must end closer to an enemy than it began.

Ban — No Half-Charges

Boar demands commitment once battle is joined.

The pack must not disengage, withdraw, or break formation after initiating combat, unless withdrawal is reasonably necessary to prevent total annihilation.

If the pack initiates a fight and then hesitates, retreats prematurely, or abandons the assault for convenience, the Totem becomes dormant and all its benefits cease.

To restore the Totem, the pack leader must reinvest the required Gnosis cost to reaffirm the bond.

If the pack repeatedly or egregiously violates this Ban, Boar may withdraw entirely, permanently severing itself from the Totem at the Storyteller's discretion.

Totem rules: Only one Totem per pack; benefits do not stack; a dormant Totem provides no benefits. Once a Totem benefit is used, it cannot be used again until after a long rest. Interacting with a Totem requires 1 action while touching it; choose either the Individual Trait or the Pack Trait.
